results.title: Outward Bound - the Challenge
results.brief_description: Part 1(a) “The Challenge”. Two participants are followed through the 26 day Outward Bound Standard Course. They experience caving, expeditioning, rock climbing, rafting, canoeing, group tasks, navigation, abseiling, exploration and self discovery. Both the challenge and the personal development changes they encounter during this adventure into self-understanding are skilfully captured on film. Part 1(b) “Other Courses”. An exciting overview of all Outward Bound programs. Part 2: Interview with the Executive Director.

results.title: Outside in
results.brief_description:
Beautiful 3-d computer animated tale of fantasy and magic when three individual lives are entwined through a twist of fate allowing their true nature to surface in a most unexpected way. No spoken word.
Created as part of Master of Fine Arts Degree in Image Arts/Computer Animation, School of Film and Animation, Rochester Institute of Technology, New York.

results.title: Out of wood (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Explores the close relationship between wood sculptor, Gay Hawkes with children of the Swan Hill North Primary School as she leads them towards the integration of the external world with the inner world of their imagination.

results.title: Out of sight
results.brief_description: A record of a small boy’s day, his observations and fantasies. It starts with his awakening, and follows him through fields and along the beach until his return home in the evening. The film ends where it began, in the boy’s bed.

results.title: Out of darkness (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Al Wasserman and CBS Public Affairs
results.brief_description: A documentary report which shows step-by-step a woman’s recovery from a severe mental illness. Dr. William C. Menninger discusses the case; Dr. Louis Chalden is shown actually treating the patient.

results.title: Our three r's
results.brief_description: A survey of educational services provided in the city of Glasgow. First there is a resume of curriculum and activities in primary schools, then in secondary schools, and finally the opportunities for technical training for day-release students.

results.title: Our lighthouse adventure
results.creator_credit: Lisa Kebbell and Queenscliff Primary School
results.brief_description:
Created as part of an investigation into the lighthouses of Queenscliff. The Queenscliff Primary School students wanted to write an adventure story in which they were the stars. It was also a way in which they could convey some of the information they had learnt about lighthouses to an audience in an entertaining way.
A photomontage accompanied by commentary from the students on CD ROM.

results.title: Our Lady of Kursk
results.brief_description: Relates the history of the icon known as Our Lady of Kursk, from its early history, starting in 1295, to the present day, including numerous miracles attributed to it. The opening scenes are of the occasion, in 1964, when the icon was brought to Australia, including the service at the Peter and Paul Church in Strathfield, N.S.W.

results.title: Our invisible committees
results.creator_credit: National Training Laboratory in Group Development
results.brief_description: The point of view is presented that one of the most important obstacles to group thought and decision-making is the conflict of social pressures which operate within individuals during a meeting. The presentation is in the form of a case study of a typical group made up of representatives from various community organisation, which is holding its initial meeting.

results.title: Our food
results.brief_description: Traces the sources and processing of many familiar foods. Shows both the old fashioned and modern ways of raising wheat, making bread, milking cows and separating cream. Includes visits to a spaghetti factory, chicken and egg farm, a dairy, a cheese factory, a potato field, an apple orchard, a fishing trawler, a meat processing plant and a sausage shop. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.
